緩.definition: slow; unhurried; sluggish; gradual; not tense; relaxed; to postpone; to defer; to stall; to stave off; to revive; to recuperate

緩不濟急.definition: lit. slow no aid to urgent (idiom); slow measures will not address a critical situation; too slow to meet a pressing need

緩兵之計.definition: delaying tactics; stalling; measures to stave off an attack; stratagem to win a respite

緩和.definition: to ease (tension); to alleviate; to moderate; to allay; to make more mild

緩徵.definition: to suspend taxes momentarily; to postpone military draft

緩急相濟.definition: to help one another in difficulty; mutual assistance in extremity

緩急輕重.definition: slight or important, urgent or non-urgent (idiom); to deal with important matters first; sense of priority; also written 輕重緩急|轻重缓急

緩期.definition: to defer; to put off (until later); to postpone

緩步.definition: to walk slowly; to amble along; gradually; slowly

緩氣.definition: to get one's breath back; to take a breather

緩聘.definition: to defer employment; to put off hiring

緩衝.definition: buffer; to cushion; to adjust to sharp changes

緩解.definition: to bring relief; to alleviate (a crisis); to dull (a pain)

緩降.definition: to decrease gradually; to descend gradually

緩降器.definition: cable reel and harness used to lower oneself to safety (e.g. from a building on fire)

緩頰.definition: to urge reconciliation; to dissuade from punitive action
